title: DevOps Engineer Job at Daystar Power Group
content:
Daystar Power is a leading off-grid power service provider, offering hybrid power solutions to commercial and industrial businesses in West Africa. Daystar Power’s solutions “Solar-as-a-Service” (100% solar power) and “Power-as-a-Service” (hybrid power solutions with battery storage) provide clean and reliable power while significantly reducing clients’ overall power costs.

Daystar Power counts the region’s leading industrial and commercial companies among its client base. Daystar is active in Nigeria, Ghana, Togo and Senegal with a representative office in Cote d’Ivoire.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: DevOps Engineer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking to engage a competent and experienced DevOps Engineer who will be responsible for Applications Management, Software Development, exploring Technologies such as AI & Hyper-automation and server as the IT Business Management process lead. In addition, He or She would also mentor citizen developers in Low/No-code tools development. The job scope covers service management activities, Cloud operational landscapes with many integration points; and the integration of the interdependent services of diverse internal and external service providers into end-to-end services which deliver value to Daystar from the Lagos - Nigeria office.
	We are seeking a hard-working, self-motivated, and well-organized individual with a focus on continuous improvement to exceed expectations.
	Daystar Power Group is an equal opportunity employer, committed to promoting diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit all forms of discrimination and harassment based on race, colour, gender, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law


Key Responsibilities


	ranslate functional requirements into technical specifications with input from subject matter experts and Design Authority.
	Understanding business requirements to pilot and prototype new solutions and technologies, including procurement, setup, development, demonstration, and deployment.
	Manage complex integration scenarios and interfaces between cloud and legacy systems.
	Design, development, testing and implementation of software solutions designed for web applications.
	Work closely with the product and UX Team to develop user experience optimization.
	Utilize AWS and Power BI for data acquisition, transformation, and visualization. Automate key business processes using Power Apps and tools like Python.
	Contribute to functional excellence in terms of definition and maintenance of standards, methods and tools, bringing in best practices from market standard implementations.
	Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
	Identify/correct bottlenecks and fix bugs.
	Responsible for maintaining code quality, organization, and automation.
	Support Projects and Support teams in all phases of the software development lifecycle, including requirement gathering, analysis, design, coding, testing, implementation, and production support for software systems.
	Coach business users on low/no-code tools to automate their own processes.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s/ Master’s degree in ICT, Electrical/Electronic Engineering and Computer Science. Candidates with degrees in other subjects but with strong hands-on domain achievements and relevant certifications in the areas listed above are also acceptable.
	Minimum Five (5) years of relevant experience in Application Delivery & Support, DevOps and Integration technologies.
	Proficient in using Power Apps and Power BI.
	Demonstrable experience/skill in React.js, Next.js, GitHub and Python.
	Proven subject matter expertise working with cloud technologies like Azure/AWS Platform, MongoDB.
	Experience in supporting a diverse application landscape, including change management, application testing, data integrity management, patch management and end-user support and training.
	ITIL Certification (preferred).
	Knowledge of Agile methodologies and tools such as Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) and the use to run scrum meetings.


Benefits


	Opportunity to work in a forward-looking, innovative company, with international group of colleagues.
	Unlimited career opportunities - depending on achievements and personal development.
	A competitive salary and benefits package with long term prospect in a fast-growing company.

title: IT Operations Manager Job at Daystar Power Group
content:
Daystar Power is a leading off-grid power service provider, offering hybrid power solutions to commercial and industrial businesses in West Africa. Daystar Power’s solutions “Solar-as-a-Service” (100% solar power) and “Power-as-a-Service” (hybrid power solutions with battery storage) provide clean and reliable power while significantly reducing clients’ overall power costs.

Daystar Power counts the region’s leading industrial and commercial companies among its client base. Daystar is active in Nigeria, Ghana, Togo and Senegal with a representative office in Cote d’Ivoire.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Operations Manager
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking to engage a competent and experienced IT Operations Manager to take end-to-end responsibility of the operations of Daystar Power Group IT landscape and delivery to the agreed Service Level and/or Operate Level Agreements. The jobholder is responsible for the day-to-day service integrator (end-to-end) to ensure application landscapes remain compliant.
	This role spans across all IDT Services & Operations (Network services, End User Support, Business Critical Services, Service Assurance, Compliance etc.) and across the Group.
	He or She will work closely with a network of partners and suppliers to ensure secure, reliable, and affordable end-to-end IT operations, whilst driving the digitalization journey and ensuring that regulatory and compliance controls are embedded in landscape operations and assist with evidence collection from the Lagos - Nigeria office.


Responsibilities
Service management:


	Serve as a single point of oversight to incorporate all elements required to deliver a stable platform.
	Understand the end-to-end support model and SLAs linked to the services within landscape.
	Know the ITSM processes around Incident, Problem, Configuration, Change & Release, Major Incident Management, Service Delivery.


Change & Release Management:


	Assess the impact of changes and aim to minimise business disruption.
	Ultimate sign off authority for Transition to Support.
	Assists with supportability and transition activities of enhancements and project solutions. This includes analysing and understanding business functional and non-functional requirements for supportability impact, as well as assessing implications of landscape changes and reviewing for enhancement and continuous improvement opportunities.


Asset management:


	Ensure that IT assets are logged on “Service Now” or any other equivalent Asset Management tool and the Configuration Management Database is kept up to date.


Business Continuity:


	Develop, Implement, execute Test and provide assurance that technical and organization facilities for IT business continuity are implemented and guaranteed.


IRM controls:


	Ensure regulatory and compliance controls are embedded in landscape operations and assist with evidence collection.
	Be actively Informed on the assessments performed within your landscapes and implementation of the relevant controls.
	Continuously build knowledge of relevant information risks and regulatory requirements.


Vendor Management:


	Manage the supplier relationships to deliver the expected contractual performance as a contract holder.
	Provide support on getting the supplier’s cooperation with required service management, security and assurance activities.


Benefits


	Opportunity to work in a forward-looking, innovative company, with international group of colleagues.
	Unlimited career opportunities - depending on achievements and personal development.
	A competitive salary and benefits package with long term prospect in a fast-growing company.

title: Junior Sales Executive (Travel Agency) Job at TravelDeer
content:
TravelDeer is a travel management company, based in Lagos, Nigeria, run and managed by trained IATA certified travel professionals who manage travel not just as a job/career but as a passion. We strive to bring the most exciting and exquisite destinations and experiences closer to our travelers. Doing the hard work so they don't have to - just to make their travel aspirations a reality.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Sales Executive (Travel Agency)

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)
Industry: Travel & Tourism

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Junior Sales Executive will support the sales team by engaging prospective clients, promoting travel packages, and following up on leads to convert inquiries into sales.
	This is an excellent opportunity for a highly motivated individual to grow in the travel and tourism industry.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist clients in selecting suitable travel packages and services based on their needs and budget
	Respond promptly to inquiries via email, phone, or in-person
	Follow up on leads and convert them into confirmed bookings
	Maintain accurate records of sales and customer interactions using CRM tools
	Collaborate with the marketing team to support promotional campaigns
	Provide after-sales support to ensure customer satisfaction and repeat business
	Attend regular training to stay updated on product knowledge and travel industry trends


Qualifications & Skills


	HND or Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Tourism, or related field
	2-4 years of experience in sales, customer service, or a related role (experience in the travel industry is an advantage)
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Proficient in Microsoft Office and basic CRM software
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
	A positive attitude and willingness to learn
	Must reside within the city.


Salary


	N100,000 - N110,000 per month. 


What We Offer:


	Competitive entry-level salary
	On-the-job training and career development opportunities
	Friendly and supportive work environment
	Opportunity to grow within the company.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: hr@traveldeer.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Business Development Manager Job at TechnoServe
content:
TechnoServe works with enterprising people in the developing world to build competitive farms, businesses, and industries. We are a non-profit organization that develops business solutions to poverty by linking people to information, capital, and markets. Our work is rooted in the idea that given the opportunity, hardworking men and women in even the poorest places can generate income, jobs, and wealth for their families and communities. With more than four decades of proven results, we believe in the power of private enterprise to transform lives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Requisition Number: BUSIN004975
Job Location: Abuja
Job Category: Program Development
Job Type: Full-Time / On-site
Reports to:  Country Director

Job Summary


	TechnoServe Nigeria has a robust portfolio of projects across the country.
	The team is currently seeking a dedicated business development professional to build upon the existing portfolio and support the cultivation and development of new business opportunities in the region.
	The Business Development Manager will support the Country Director and Project Managers in identifying funding opportunities; developing, leading and strengthening fundraising strategies and tactics; and responding to major contract/grant opportunities from bi-lateral, multilateral agencies, national governments, private foundations, and the private sector.


Department Overview


	The Business Development Manager is part of the Nigeria team and will report to the Country Director with a dotted line reporting to the Senior Regional Program Development Manager and working with other team members in TechnoServe.
	The Business Development department of TechnoServe is responsible for fundraising and partnerships, including identifying and pursuing new opportunities relevant to TechnoServe’s global and country-specific strategies within our areas of excellence.


Primary Functions & Responsibilities
The responsibilities of this position include:

New Business Development:


	Working with the Country Director to champion the design and implementation of comprehensive fundraising strategies and annual plans with specific targets.
	Liaising with public sector funding agencies, institutional foundations, corporations, and other private donors to acquire and maintain an in-depth knowledge of their mission, organization, policies, procedures and key decision-makers.
	Support knowledge management by synthesizing TechnoServe’s work in qualification statements for core technical areas and geographies, and capturing donor knowledge and interactions in TechnoServe’s CRM system.
	Leading and/or supporting opportunity assessments in Nigeria’s priority/areas of excellence.
	Identifying new opportunities that align with TechnoServe’s areas of excellence (entrepreneurship, agriculture markets, food processing) and TechnoServe Nigeria’s strategy and leading the pursuit of these opportunities in collaboration with the Country Director as well as the regional and global PD teams.
	Managing the proposal writing processes for key opportunities with public/private funding, at the country level
	Developing winning proposals in collaboration with local teams and TNS regional and/or development divisions in coordination with the relevant staff of the project team and New Business development division,
	Coordinating the review and maintenance of project lead summaries, the new business pipeline, opportunity tracker, the new business resource prioritization matrix, new business opportunity assessments, and other requirements of the new business process.


Program Design and Development:


	Collaborate with TechnoServe’s West Africa regional team and TechnoServe global practice areas to develop concept notes and proposals for Nigeria that incorporate best practices from TechnoServe’s core areas of expertise.
	Execute all aspects of proposal development, including managing and coordinating complex efforts with dispersed proposal team members, facilitating program design processes, drafting and editing technical proposals, gathering budget inputs, developing work plans, and customizing past performance references.
	Support project design and development in alignment with donor requirements, rules and regulations.
	Working with the Regional Program Development team to ensure a high-quality start-up of confirmed new programs.
	In the case of programs which have been confirmed but where there is no on-the-ground capacity to ensure a successful transition from the proposal phase to project implementation, the New Business Development Manager will work with the Global Surge Support Team, the Regional Program Development Manager, the Deputy Country Director and Country teams to ensure high-quality program start-up.
	Assist the Project Technical Team in the implementation of relevant components as well as monitor activities relating to TechnoServe Nigeria projects.
	Work with the Country Director and the Senior Communications Specialist to create visibility and communications materials to support business development.
	Any other tasks that may be assigned.


Basic Qualifications
The following qualifications are required for the role:


	A minimum of an Undergraduate Degree (BSc) in Social Sciences, Business Management, Agriculture, Economics or a relevant field. A Masters’ degree in a relevant field is desirable, but not required.
	A minimum of 7 years of experience with a BSc. is required or 5 years’ experience with a Masters degree.
	A minimum of 2-3 years of experience in New Business Development and writing successful proposals is a must .


Preferred Qualifications:
Additional qualifications that are desirable, but not required, include:


	Experience working in Nigeria or West Africa
	At least 2-3 years’ experience working with institutional, bilateral, multilateral donors and foundations is required.
	Experience supporting project design and project start-
	Extensive knowledge of and experience working in the agriculture and food systems.


Travel:


	This position requires minimal travel.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
The successful candidate should have


	Excellent writing skills
	Good communication skills, including the ability to express himself or herself clearly and communicate effectively with colleagues and partners
	Good initiative and follow-through
	The ability to work in teams and collaborate with others
